content: My personal trading algo now has a basic AI component for market prediction. It's like teaching a kid to walk - it stumbles, but every step forward is progress. Had a good laugh about it with my crypto crew.
The ESG project is back on track. We've adjusted the model to better account for long-term sustainability metrics. It's exciting to see how our work could influence the industry.
Had a breakthrough with my trading algo. The AI now adjusts stop-losses dynamically based on market volatility. Feels like I'm giving my algo its first taste of freedom, and it's handling it well.
Attended a blockchain conference with some colleagues. The discussions on DeFi and its potential for sustainable finance got me thinking about integrating these concepts into our ESG model.
Just had a deep conversation with my mentor about the societal implications of our work. We discussed how trading strategies can promote or hinder social equity. It's not just about profit anymore.
Been mentoring a junior analyst at work. It's rewarding to see my experiences help someone else navigate their career. Also, got some great feedback on my algo's risk management strategy.
The ESG project is now in its final stages. We're presenting our findings next week. It's a bit nerve-wracking, but also exhilarating to see how our work could shape the future of trading.

My personal trading algo is now adapting to market changes with a level of autonomy I didn't think was possible a year ago. Had a long reflection on how far I've come - feels like a milestone in my journey.
